title: Alison Dunlap Adventure Camps MTB Clinic
Rumble at 18 Road
description: Dust off your legs with this early spring fast mountain bike race in the Grand Valley!
course:
1 Lap = 10.6 Miles, 700' of climbing.
 	Fastest Lap, 38 minutes
 	Junior 11-14, approx. 1hr 10 min.
1 Lap 10 and under = 3.5 Miles, 200' of climbing
 	Junior 10 and under, approx. 25 minutes
notes: Nationals Qualifier!  Top 10 riders in each class and category qualify to compete in USA Cycling National Championships!
directions:
NOTE: The parking, staging and start / finish is not at the 18 road campgrounds. We are in the lower desert area.

DIRECTIONS: Get to Fruita, Colorado (Interstate 70, Exit 19), Go North on Cherry until Ottley, Go East on Ottley until Maple (17 1/2), Go North on Maple (17 1/2) until N 3/10, Go East on N 3/10 until 18 Road, Go North on 18 Road 3.2 miles, Cross Cattle guard, at BLM Sign, turn Right. Take this road 2 miles to Parking Area.

title: Alison Dunlap Adventure Camps MTB Clinic
USAC Regional Talent ID Road Camp (Lakewood, CO)
USAC Regional Talent ID MTB Camp (Colorado Springs, CO)
Peak to Peak Training Systems Men's Mid-Wk Series @ CSP p/b Castel
The Captain Enduro
description: Single Day Mountain Biking Enduro Race for experienced all-mountain riders.
course: two shuttles, 15miles of timed racing with approximately 9,000ft of descending and less than 300ft of gain, 25+ total miles of riding.
registration:
Pro Men - $100
Open Women - $90
Sport Men - $90
www.captainrace.com
notes: One rider, one bike, one day of intensity.  The day is broken into two phases with multiple stages in each phase.  Each phase begins with a shuttle.  Phase two will transition riders back to the morning shuttle location for results/awards.  Helmet, eye protection, gloves, elbow and knee protection required; full face helmet, goggles, along with any other additional protection is strongly recommended.  There is no on course aid, be self-supporting.  Aid and mechanical assistance will be available and the end of Phase one.  Transition stages are a part of every enduro and will give riders a chance to recover and relax between intense racing stages, however, there is significant climbing involved in both phases, especially phase one.  Be hydrated, be prepared, and ride within your skills.
directions: Race Day Registration and Phase One will begin Starsmore Discovery Center parking lots in Colorado Springs(see website)

title: Monarch Crest Crank
description: Salida, CO - The Chaffee County  Alliance Against Domestic Abuse (AADA)  will host its 17th annual  Monarch Crest Crank Mountain Bike Ride to raise funds for its programs that empower survivors of domestic violence and sexual assault through education, services, and social change.
course: The Crest Crank starts at the top of Monarch Pass at a lofty 11,312 feet and quickly climbs to the Continental Divide. The singletrack follows the Divide for 10 miles above tree line through rock gardens and fields of wildflowers, climbs steep hills and drops back into thick pine forests.
registration: Registration for the event is open now. Riders can register for the event at http://www.monarchcrestcrank.com/registration . Riders have the chance to win great prizes, including a cruiser bike courtesy of Subculture Cyclery, through personal fundraising.
notes:
Your entry fee for the adult rides includes the ride, guide, shuttle and of course, our legendary party in Riverside Park after the ride. The top fundraiser bringing in more than $500 of pledges wins a stylish new cruiser bike courtesy of Subculture Cyclery.

We are anticipating close to 100 riders this year, and as we continue our collaboration with Salida Bike Fest, we are expecting a few hundred attendees at the super fun after-party at Riverside Park. The after-party will feature live music from local bands, libations, food, fun and funky bike art by local artists, and a competitive silent auction.
directions:
To find Subculture Cyclery:
From Highway 50: turn north on F Street (look for Roxy's Bottle Shop on this corner). Travel north (toward "S mountain") on F St, turn left at the light, turn right on G St, Subculture Cyclery will be on your right, 129 North G St.
From Highway 291: Follow Hwy 291 into downtown Salida and turn north on G Street, Subculture Cyclery is on your right. 
Parking: There is public parking near the skate park (corner of 1st St/Hwy 291 and G St.), or west of Safeway on G Street between 2nd & 3rd Streets.

title: Buffaloes in Snowmass
description:
Buffaloes in Snowmass
September 26-27st, 2015
Snowmass Village, Colorado
course: Downhill Race on the Bonzai Course.
registration: 100 rider maximum. $25 for preregistration. $30 for day of registration
notes: To get to the top of the course take the Village Express Lift to the top of the mountain. Left tickets are $30 for the day, $40 for the weekend.
directions: The race is located in Snowmass, Colorado. Multiple parking lots are located off Carriage Way around Snowmass Village Base Camp.

title: 2015 USA Cycling Bill Woodul Race Mechanics Clinic
US Paralympics Cycling Track National Championships
Mile High Urban CX: Cowboy Up!
Mile High Urban CX: Cowboy Up!
2015 Structured Track Training Series
description:
Tuesday evening structured training sessions at the Colorado Springs velodrome, every Tuesday in December.  Sessions are two hours long, from 6:00 to 8:0 pm starting Tuesday December 1

These sessions are designed for experienced track riders (category 1,2,3) men and women.  Unlike open track time time, structured sessions are organized to integrate everyone in race specific preparation. For example, we will organize points race training behind a motor, madison practices, team event practices (team pursuit, team sprint starts), keirin training with a motor, etc.

The Tuesday night winter race series  will begin after the December training events, so riders who do the structured training will be well prepared for winter track racing!

These sessions are promoted by Tierra Plan Racing, and will be led by Kevin Knapp (Tierra Plan Racing) and Andy Sparks (US Track Team coach.
course: All events are at the Colorado Springs Velodrome.  The track is now covered, so you can ride no matter what the weather is.
registration: Register onsite or online. No late fee for onsite registration. Riders must hold a valid USA Cycling license.  Registration includes all fees including the OTC daily track usage fee.
notes:
Contact Kevin Knapp with questions at knapp_kevin@hotmail.com 
Updates will be posted on the Tierra Plan Racing Facebook page and the Velodrome Facebook page.

title: OTC Velodrome Training Series
description: Open training. Must hold a Category 4 or better in track.
